title: Police 'find significant amount of drugs' hidden in kid's pencil case during raid on the Gold Coast
text:
Police have allegedly found a 'significant' amount of drugs hidden in a child's pencil case and scattered around a home during a raid on the Gold Coast.

The drugs were allegedly uncovered at an Ormeau Hills home on Sunday, following a six-month police investigation.

Detectives searched the Mullins Street property at 5.20pm and allegedly found about 225 MDMA tablets, 160 grams of MDMA powder, 91 grams of cocaine and 38 grams of methylamphetamine.

Police have allegedly found a 'significant' amount of drugs hidden in a child's pencil case (left) and scattered around a home during a raid on the Gold Coast

They also seized 25 grams of ketamine, 12 vials of testosterone, six litres of GHB, 100ml of cannabis oil and three tasers.

Video footage from the raid shows detectives scour the cupboards of the property to find substances hidden in a pencil case and a blending container.

A 36-year-old man was arrested at the scene and has since been charged with offences related to possessing, trafficking and producing dangerous drugs as well as possessing weapons.

The man will reappear in the Southport Magistrates Court on November 14.

The raid was part of a six-month long operation addressing drug crime in the Pimpama and Ormeau areas.

Police urge anyone with further information to contact Policelink on 131 444.

description: The drugs were allegedly uncovered at an Ormeau Hills home, on the Gold Coast, following a six-month police investigation.
